title: Erik Lamela faces scan as boss Mauricio Pochettino says Spurs are ‘concerned’ about his string of injuries & ailments
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments TOTTENHAM will send Erik Lamela for a scan today after admitting they are becoming concerned about his injury nightmare. 
The Argentine playmaker has not made an appearance for three months having been hit by a string of ailments. PA:Press Association 4 Spurs playmaker Erik Lamela has been troubled by injuries for most of the season 
And Spurs are worried after a specialist at his former club Roma failed to cure a long-standing hip problem. 
Keep up to date with ALL the latest Tottenham news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Boss Mauricio Pochettino said: “Tomorrow he will have a scan. It’s difficult to give a time to say when he will come back. There are still some problems. 
“We need to wait and see, but we are now starting to be concerned. PA:Press Association Argentine star Lamela began the season in top form but has been blighted by niggles for three months 
“It is nearly three months and we have not moved on.” 
Lamela , 24, has not played since coming on as a sub in the 2-1 EFL Cup defeat at Liverpool on October 25. 
Tottenham first said he had a virus. Then he hurt his back and suffered a hip problem. 
Asked if Lamela needs surgery, Poch said: “We have never been advised that, so we need to wait to see the results of the scan first.” 
Pochettino also spoke of his relief that Jan Vertonghen’s injury is not as serious as first feared. The Belgian defender faced a lengthy spell out after injuring his ankle in Spurs’ 4-0 win over West Brom on Saturday. 
But he is now only expected to be out for six to eight weeks with slight ligament damage. 
Pochettino said: “At first it looked really bad. 
“But the doctor thinks it’s not as bad as we thought at the beginning. 
“He doesn’t need surgery. I don’t want to set a time limit, but if your mind is positive you can recover early.” Tottenham Hotspur unveil their swanky hospitality for the new stadium
